intro: Meibomia occidentalis, commonly known as the West African meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It produces small, dry fruits called capsules, which contain numerous tiny seeds. Meibomia occidentalis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
